dcterms:creator: W. A. Smith
R. B. Randall
dcterms:description: This extensively utilized dataset is collected by the Bearing Data Center at Case Western Reserve University. The dataset is generated by applying electro-discharge machining (EDM) to motor deep groove ball bearings to artificially induce faults. Specifically, faults with diameters of 0.007 inches, 0.014 inches, and 0.021 inches are introduced into the inner race, outer race, and ball of the bearings, respectively. Vibration data is recorded at both the drive-end (DE) and fan-end (FE) under varying motor loads and speeds.
dcterms:title: Case Western Reserve University bearing faults dataset (CWRU)

dcterms:description: A proprietary dataset collected by the authors employing angular contact ball bearings (HC7003) designed for high-speed rotational machinery. The dataset includes vibration signals generated by bearings with induced faults at the outer race, inner race, and ball, encompassing three levels of severity: slight, moderate, and severe.
dcterms:title: Our bearing dataset
